result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:01 AM Crt Comm: Timothy C. Heckmann, RPR: Unmonitored DAR, Clk: S. Bridges. Defendant Andre Ashanta Doby in court in custody.  Attorney Nicholas Von Davis in court for Andre Ashanta Doby.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. S/T of Detective Joseph Kastens. Direct by ADA Becker. Cross by Atty. Davis. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Court sets ARGN. Bond to continue in substance and form. Adjourned 9:24  AM. srb

22R 013153.   Posted by T. Torgerson. olg
Request for release/modification/change in sentence. Request bond modification, filed by DE. olg    9/20/2022 Per SJN, Denied. olg
Filed by Atty Davis. arc   to kp

AMENDED 

$100 ON FILE

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing and ETG testing at least ONE time per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must report to the Justice Support Center immediately. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Joseph Nitchals or Rachel Slabey.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

Court notes this matter is a continued bond hearing. DE on PO Hold. Atty Dolfi states their office has reached out to over a dozen private attorney's due to the conflict with thte PD's Office.
